page.title: 11Courteenhall M.1. Motorway
page.content:
The Northamptonshire section of the motorway to Junction 18 at Crick was opened in 1959. The 37 kilometres in Northamptonshire make up one of the longest stretches of motorway to run through a single county. The official averages for vehicles using the M1 in Northamptonshire as given by the County Surveyors Dept. are as follows: (Week commencing 10/6/85) Watford Gap, Northbound Southbound 5 Day average 39,739 41,939 7 Day average 36,700 39,748 Rothersthorpe 5 Day average 36,081 35,571 7 Day average 33,250 33,165
Any temporary closure of the Motorway brings a very noticable increase in noise and traffic congestion on local roads.
